column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Play Non‐Physical Games for All Ages
#Text=at Family Gatherings
#Text=The meal is demolished , no one is tempted to eat even a wafer thin mint , and inertia is setting in .

#Text=By establishing a tradition of quiet , mental games that do not involve a lot of running around , or bats and balls , the whole gang can laugh together , share memories , and flex their creativity skills .
#Text=A few simple guidelines can make the time spent together fun and productive .
#Text=Wait !
#Text=What about the big game on TV ?
#Text=Mute it and make your own happy memories .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Arrange chairs in a circle .

#Text=Bring everyone at the dinner , lunch or gathering from the youngest to the oldest , into the room and , with a person in charge , announce the ground rules : speak clearly , be concise , and project your voice .
#Text=Assist those who need a little help .
#Text=Start with introductions .
#Text=Each person must tell his or her name in rhyme .
#Text=It 's OK to use middle or last names if they lend themselves better to rhyming .
#Text=For example , My name is Sue and I live at the zoo .
#Text=My name is Bob and I 'm no snob .
#Text=Corny , yes , but it will get people relaxed and laughing .
#Text=Play Here Comes the Tray .
#Text=Who has n't played this at a birthday party or shower ?
#Text=Distribute mini legal pads , pencils and bring out a tray with 10 or so common items on it .
#Text=Have a volunteer , perhaps the person who chose the items and wo n't be taking part in the guessing , walk slowly circle the group for approximately 3 minutes .
#Text=Tell the participants to take a long , hard look because after the tray is gone , each person must try to remember all items displayed and list them on their pads .
#Text=If there are really young participants , work in teams of two .
#Text=At the end , have the person with the most items listed read their list aloud to the group .
#Text=Ask people to raise their hands if they accounted for the item .
#Text=Decide who or which team came closest to remembering the most items .
#Text=Prizes are optional , but make them small and insignificant .
#Text=Fun is the order of the day , not loot .
#Text=Play Word Repeat , another memory game .
#Text=Start anywhere in the circle and have that person say a word associated with the holiday you are celebrating .
#Text=For example , " cranberries " for a Thanksgiving gathering .
#Text=The next person must repeat the first word and add another .
#Text=" Cranberries and gravy " Then , perhaps , " cranberries , gravy and mincemeat pie , " continuing around the circle .

column1: #Text=After linking five or six words , people will start calling out helpful prompts and it might get a little silly .
#Text=All the better , more laughs , more fun .
#Text=Play Family History .
#Text=It is a game that relies on achievements of various members .
#Text=On a prepared handout , ask questions from the participant 's lives , living or dead .
#Text=Who fought in the Civil War ?
#Text=Who left home at age eighteen to became a secretary ?
#Text=Who wore a wedding dress made by her mother and aunt ?
#Text=Who went to Paris as part of a college course ?
#Text=Who , in the family made the best chili ?
#Text=Give
#Text=Discussion questions .
#Text=If I Won the Lottery , how would I use the money ?
#Text=Who changed your life ?
#Text=Share the " whys " and " hows " .
#Text=Who was your favorite teacher and why ?
#Text=What advice did someone give you that you use today ?
#Text=Have a number of questions ready , read them aloud and allow time for everyone to give an opinion .
#Text=As a closing exercise , have each person write a note to the person on his/her right and pay them a compliment .
#Text=Even if that person is n't familiar , perhaps a guest to the party , there will be nice things to write about them . "

column1: #Text=It might be necessary to make up a poster with the common parts of speech and their meanings to display as you play the game .
#Text=Select themes carefully , these books run the gamut from a barrel of laughs for young kids to steamy games for adult parties .
#Text=They can generate some memorable and bizarre scenarios .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Playing nice is something we learned at home .
#Text=Keeping things suitable for mixed company of all ages is imperative .
#Text=Avoid religion , politics , or current events of an inflammatory nature .
#Text=Leaving somebody out of the fun is unforgivable .
#Text=Just as negatively critiquing another person 's answer or response .
#Text=The time spent together playing games is intended to be relaxing and lighthearted .
#Text=Do your part to make sure each person leaves having had a good experience .
